quests.name: The Past
quests.description:
You can feel them, pulling your soul in countless directions as they call out to you.

There are more eyes out there... More information. Those eyes... they're the key to finding out what really happened. They have to be.

tasks.longDescription: FIND US WITHIN THE RUINS OF WHAT CAME BEFORE.

quests.name: The Truth
quests.description:
No... No No No No No. This isn't right. The Eyes... their demands... they're using you. They're using you to reunite... and do something terrible. You're sure of it, now. But... but what?

...

That's it. They caused the Permafrost. Whatever they power... it's the cause. You need to find it. You need to learn the truth.

There... there has to be something here. Some sort of explanation, for what the hell happened.

tasks.longDescription:
There has to be some kind of explanation for this. Something that could tell you how it happened...

There has to be something.

pages: {"text":"I’m writing this right before leaving this damned castle. The King, Alex, everyone is dead.  I was one of the leaders of the program which experimented with the portal and now I’m the last member alive, as far as I know. This damned portal didn’t work as intended, not at all."}

{"text":" It was supposed to transport us to the other castles, but it didn’t. Three weeks ago, the first expedition went in, but never returned.Two weeks ago, tall, black monster with purple eyes started crawling out of the portal, and wreaking havoc in the castle."}

{"text":"We managed to stop these monstrosities, but we soon realized that they were in fact the members of the past expeditions, disfigured beyond recognition.Countless other attacks by these monsters rained on the castle, until I was the only human alive. "}

{"text":"I managed to destroy the Powered Core and to rip all the damned eyes out of their socket. As far as I’m alive, my goal will always be to hide them, so no one can lay the same curse upon themselves.,"}

{"text":"No mountain, no rainforest, no water temple shall stop me, for I’m the only one capable of preventing this mayhem from happening again. If you’re standing here, you’ve probably got them. Or not. I don’t care."}
{"text":"But beware, don’t go in the portal. It deceives you, promising glory and fame. It lies, for only death is beyond the portal. If you go in, demise will be your §l §   End."}
tag.title: To Whomever It May Concern
tag.author: A Selfless Adventurer

quests.name: Something's Missing...
quests.description:
...It's clear, now. The Eyes did this. They killed your people. They made the Endermen. They... that portal... it did everything. The ancient, molding book in your hands confirms it.

That portal... it was a portal to another dimension. The home of the Endermen. The Eye of the Storm. The End.

The Eyes were lying to you. They want nothing more than to open that stupid portal, and cleanse the world with this stupid storm.

But you're not gonna let them. Actually, you know what? Screw it. Screw the Eyes. Screw whatever's on the other side of the portal. In fact? You're gonna go in there, you're gonna find whatever caused this storm...

And you're gonna kill it.

But first... you need to complete the portal. And you're gonna do it your own way. You'll make your own final piece, and stop the eyes from coming together again. You don't know whether or not it'll work... but that doesn't matter.

It's time to end this.

tasks.longDescription: You'll need something to counteract the Cold Eye. Something... something from the Nether. You`ve felt that now-familiar pull that the eyes give off in the Basalt Deltas... there must be something there that you could use.

You know what you need to do, now. An unknown recipe. A final, eleventh eye, made by human hands... to counteract the rest, and stabilize their limitless magic. The Crystal Eye.

Place an eye of ender down in the center of a crafting table, and surround it with the four end crystal fragments, one on each side.

With this final piece... you won't repeat the mistakes of the past. You'll face the heart of the Permafrost head on, and avenge the world that it ravaged.

quests.name: The Source
quests.description:
This eye gives you an uneasy feeling. It feels like the storm itself is watching you...

Maybe it is. Maybe this is one of the things that did it. Maybe the Cold Eye is the cause.

It's strange. It feels like this one is stronger than the rest. Like it has a stronger connection to wherever it came from.

tasks.longDescription: You found the Cold Eye, a mysterious frozen eye that seems to resonate with the Permafrost.

quests.name: Into the Breach
quests.description:
At long last... everything is ready.

 You've defied the Eyes. You've powered the core. You've created an Eye of your own, one that will hopefully counteract the effect of the other eyes. Now... all that's left is to activate that portal, and face down whatever the hell awaits you on the other side.

It's time to end this, and make sure the Permafrost never happens again.

tasks.longDescription:
Activate the Portal, and go through.

Pure cold practically emanates from the portal itself... You're getting the feeling that the tactics you've used to warm yourself thus far won't be enough on the other side.

quests.name: Within the Fortress
quests.description:
Ah, the Nether. A rather hostile place... but it's still the same, at least.

Even if all of the portals leading to it were destroyed when the Permafrost struck, you managed to find your way back into the fiery dimension. And now... you found one of the eyes. It almost seems mundane, compared to the rest of them. It feels... surprisingly normal.

tasks.longDescription: You found the Nether Eye in the depths of a Nether Fortress.

quests.name: Ancient Knowledge
quests.description:
This eye... it speaks. When you hold it, you can hear whispers in the back of your mind. Whispers of... knowledge. Of technology.

Of Redstone.

Redstone has been integral to society for so long... even the first people had knowledge of Redstone. But... this feels older. Like it taught someone long before you.

tasks.longDescription: You found the Rogue Eye; an incredibly old eye that whispers of ancient secrets.

quests.name: A Return to Normalcy
quests.description:
This eye feels... pleasant. It feels like the past, before the storm. Those mineshafts felt so much more familiar than the surface. They were left untouched by the Permafrost, as was the rest of the underground...

It just goes to show... Even in the Permafrost, you can thrive. There's still life. There's still hope.

Hold onto it, and never let go.

tasks.longDescription: You can still rebuild. You can't reverse the storm, but you can adapt to it. You found the Lost Eye.

quests.name: REUNITE US.
quests.description:
You can hear them SCREAMING in the back of your head, now. You've put them together. You've powered the Core. And now, they're telling you where to go.

A ruined castle, hidden away and left to decay for centuries. That... that must be where the Eyes want to be taken.

You can get there... but... you'll need to figure out how.

tasks.longDescription:
REUNITE US.

MAKE US WHOLE AGAIN.

WIPE THIS SLATE CLEAN.

quests.name: Long Before the Storm
quests.description:
The Guardians have existed for eons, at this point. They were there at the rise of civilization... and now, you supposed, they were there at its end.

However, one thing always confused you. The Guardians are artificial. They aren't living creatures. They're constructs, much like the golems. They were created to guard the temples, but the temples have been empty for... well... eons. Was there a civilization that came before yours? And... if so... where did they go, and why were their creations built with these eyes?

tasks.longDescription: You found the Guardian Eye; an eye used in the creation of ancient aquatic constructs.

quests.name: The Sentinel, Slain
quests.description:
You can still remember the first time you saw a Wither. The way it hovered vigilant in place, much like the loyal Iron Golem... but it was something more. The Wither was a testament of human persistence and dedication, a sentinel constructed of inherently hostile materials, made into a loyal guard and companion.

Now, without anything to watch over, the man made construct simply went berserk, destroying everything in its path.

When you killed it, something rolled out of the middle skull... something that wasn't usually there. The Wither Eye stares coldly at you, its magic and purpose long since dulled.

You can feel that same otherworldly presence watching you, now. Even the Withers, the pinnacle of human persistence, the living proof of the fact that humanity can find use in even the most dangerous of things... have been worn down. It's a sad sight.

tasks.longDescription: You found the Wither Eye. A strange eye found within a sentinel that had long since lost its purpose.

quests.name: Hidden Away
quests.description:
Someone left this here a long time ago. They buried it under the sand and sailed away, with the only map leading to it in their possession.

The Black Eye was never meant to be found... but, nonetheless, you found it. Whoever hid that eye there is long gone, now. They might've died in the shipwreck where you found the treasure map. Who knows?

Certainly not you. All that matters is that you've managed to find it.

tasks.longDescription: You found the Black Eye in a buried treasure trove, hidden away by someone long dead.

quests.name: The Core Component
quests.description:
Something's missing. You've been collecting these eyes... but for what? All they've given you are some context clues... some hints as to what's really going on... but there has to be something bigger going on...

...

The eyes want to be reunited.

They want to become whole again.

...

That's it. They're meant to power things. The eyes are incredibly magical, incredibly dangerous power sources. And... when they all come together... they power something massive. But... they need a core. Something to channel all of their power, to do something...

Something otherworldly. You don't know what. But you need to find out.

tasks.longDescription: Craft something that could channel the magic of the eyes into some sort of contraption. You can... hear them, whispering instructions to you. Netherite and obsidian.
The Core needs to be powered. It NEEDS to be powered. IT NEEDS TO BE POWERED. POWER THE CORE. I DEMAND IT.

quests.name: The Storm
quests.description:
You can feel them, pulling your soul in countless directions as they call out to you.

There are more eyes out there... More information. Those eyes... they're the key to finding out what really happened. They have to be.

tasks.longDescription: FIND US. WE WILL TELL YOU EVERYTHING.

quests.name: The Heart of the Storm
quests.description:
This is it.

This is the Heart of the Storm.

Everything you've done has led up to this.

You can feel the frigid cold in your very soul. It disregards the fire, pierces through protection... chills you to your very core.

But you've endured the cold for far too long now to give up. The thing that caused the Permafrost is here... and you're gonna kill it.

This is the End.

tasks.longDescription: Slay the Ender Dragon.

quests.name: Something Otherworldly
quests.description:
It's staring into your soul... The eye. There's something strange about it. Something powerful about it.

Something cataclysmic about it.

You need to find out what.

tasks.longDescription: One down. Nine to go.

quests.name: The Beyond
quests.description:
You can feel them, pulling your soul in countless directions as they call out to you.

There are more eyes out there... More information. Those eyes... they're the key to finding out what really happened. They have to be.

tasks.longDescription: FIND US IN A LAND BEYOND THE STORM.

quests.name: The Sands of Time
quests.description:
Entering a desert temple felt... strange. You weren't supposed to go anywhere near them... much less delve directly into one.

But... that's beside the point. These ancient structures have been left alone since... practically the dawn of time. The dusty old eye that you had found within faintly pulsed with magic, far too weak to be used. Its power has been lost to the sands of time.

tasks.longDescription: You found the Old Eye, a relic whose magic has been dulled over the centuries.

quests.name: Not of This World
quests.description:
The Evoker... one of the pillagers... they were channeling the magic of this eye directly. You watched as the Vex, those strange flying creatures, appeared before your very eyes.

That wasn't normal. Those things came from... somewhere else. Somewhere far beyond your world, beyond even the Nether.

...Is there another world, out there?

tasks.longDescription: You found the Magical Eye, a strange eye used by the Evokers to summon things... not of this world.

quests.name: The Survivors
quests.description:
You can feel them, pulling your soul in countless directions as they call out to you.

There are more eyes out there... More information. Those eyes... they're the key to finding out what really happened. They have to be.

tasks.longDescription: FIND US WITH THE ONES WHO STILL WANDER THIS DOOMED WORLD.

quests.name: Survival of the Fittest
quests.description:
Before you found this eye, it was a mystery to you how the Pillagers managed to survive the storm for this long.

Now, you can see why. They used the Eyes. You don't know how they were used... but they were. And now, you have one. Maybe... just maybe... you could use one, too.
